speaker: ALENCON
line: And have thee reverenced like a blessed saint:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: ALENCON
line: Employ thee then, sweet virgin, for our good.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Then thus it must be; this doth Joan devise:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: By fair persuasions mix'd with sugar'd words

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: We will entice the Duke of Burgundy

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: To leave the Talbot and to follow us.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Ay, marry, sweeting, if we could do that,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: France were no place for Henry's warriors;

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Nor should that nation boast it so with us,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: But be extirped from our provinces.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: ALENCON
line: For ever should they be expulsed from France

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: ALENCON
line: And not have title of an earldom here.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Your honours shall perceive how I will work

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: To bring this matter to the wished end.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Hark! by the sound of drum you may perceive

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Their powers are marching unto Paris-ward.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: There goes the Talbot, with his colours spread,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And all the troops of English after him.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Now in the rearward comes the duke and his:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Fortune in favour makes him lag behind.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Summon a parley; we will talk with him.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: A parley with the Duke of Burgundy!

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Who craves a parley with the Burgundy?

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: The princely Charles of France, thy countryman.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: What say'st thou, Charles? for I am marching hence.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Speak, Pucelle, and enchant him with thy words.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Brave Burgundy, undoubted hope of France!

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Stay, let thy humble handmaid speak to thee.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Speak on; but be not over-tedious.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Look on thy country, look on fertile France,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And see the cities and the towns defaced

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: By wasting ruin of the cruel foe.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: As looks the mother on her lowly babe

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: When death doth close his tender dying eyes,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: See, see the pining malady of France;

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Behold the wounds, the most unnatural wounds,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Which thou thyself hast given her woful breast.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: O, turn thy edged sword another way;

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Strike those that hurt, and hurt not those that help.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: One drop of blood drawn from thy country's bosom

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Should grieve thee more than streams of foreign gore:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Return thee therefore with a flood of tears,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And wash away thy country's stained spots.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Either she hath bewitch'd me with her words,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Or nature makes me suddenly relent.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Besides, all French and France exclaims on thee,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Doubting thy birth and lawful progeny.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Who joint'st thou with but with a lordly nation

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: That will not trust thee but for profit's sake?

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: When Talbot hath set footing once in France

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And fashion'd thee that instrument of ill,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Who then but English Henry will be lord

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And thou be thrust out like a fugitive?

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Call we to mind, and mark but this for proof,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Was not the Duke of Orleans thy foe?

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And was he not in England prisoner?

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: But when they heard he was thine enemy,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: They set him free without his ransom paid,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: In spite of Burgundy and all his friends.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: See, then, thou fight'st against thy countrymen

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: And joint'st with them will be thy slaughtermen.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Come, come, return; return, thou wandering lord:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Charles and the rest will take thee in their arms.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: I am vanquished; these haughty words of hers

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Have batter'd me like roaring cannon-shot,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: And made me almost yield upon my knees.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Forgive me, country, and sweet countrymen,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: And, lords, accept this hearty kind embrace:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: My forces and my power of men are yours:

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: So farewell, Talbot; I'll no longer trust thee.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Aside  Done like a Frenchman: turn, and turn again!

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Welcome, brave duke! thy friendship makes us fresh.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
line: And doth beget new courage in our breasts.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: ALENCON
line: Pucelle hath bravely play'd her part in this,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: ALENCON
line: And doth deserve a coronet of gold.

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Now let us on, my lords, and join our powers,

scene: SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.
speaker: CHARLES
line: And seek how we may prejudice the foe.

speaker: TALBOT
line: My gracious prince, and honourable peers,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Hearing of your arrival in this realm,

speaker: TALBOT
line: I have awhile given truce unto my wars,

speaker: TALBOT
line: To do my duty to my sovereign:

speaker: TALBOT
line: In sign, whereof, this arm, that hath reclaim'd

speaker: TALBOT
line: To your obedience fifty fortresses,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Twelve cities and seven walled towns of strength,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Beside five hundred prisoners of esteem,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Lets fall his sword before your highness' feet,

speaker: TALBOT
line: And with submissive loyalty of heart

speaker: TALBOT
line: Ascribes the glory of his conquest got

speaker: TALBOT
line: First to my God and next unto your grace.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Is this the Lord Talbot, uncle Gloucester,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That hath so long been resident in France?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Yes, if it please your majesty, my liege.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Welcome, brave captain and victorious lord!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: When I was young, as yet I am not old,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I do remember how my father said

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: A stouter champion never handled sword.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Long since we were resolved of your truth,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Your faithful service and your toil in war;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Yet never have you tasted our reward,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Or been reguerdon'd with so much as thanks,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Because till now we never saw your face:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Therefore, stand up; and, for these good deserts,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: We here create you Earl of Shrewsbury;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And in our coronation take your place.

speaker: VERNON
line: Now, sir, to you, that were so hot at sea,

speaker: VERNON
line: Disgracing of these colours that I wear

speaker: VERNON
line: In honour of my noble Lord of York:

speaker: VERNON
line: Darest thou maintain the former words thou spakest?

speaker: BASSET
line: Yes, sir; as well as you dare patronage

speaker: BASSET
line: The envious barking of your saucy tongue

speaker: BASSET
line: Against my lord the Duke of Somerset.

speaker: VERNON
line: Sirrah, thy lord I honour as he is.

speaker: BASSET
line: Why, what is he? as good a man as York.

speaker: VERNON
line: Hark ye; not so: in witness, take ye that.

speaker: BASSET
line: Villain, thou know'st the law of arms is such

speaker: BASSET
line: That whoso draws a sword, 'tis present death,

speaker: BASSET
line: Or else this blow should broach thy dearest blood.

speaker: BASSET
line: But I'll unto his majesty, and crave

speaker: BASSET
line: I may have liberty to venge this wrong;

speaker: BASSET
line: When thou shalt see I'll meet thee to thy cost.

speaker: VERNON
line: Well, miscreant, I'll be there as soon as you;

speaker: VERNON
line: And, after, meet you sooner than you would.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Lord bishop, set the crown upon his head.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BISHOP OF WINCHESTER
line: God save King Henry, of that name the sixth!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Now, governor of Paris, take your oath,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That you elect no other king but him;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Esteem none friends but such as are his friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And none your foes but such as shall pretend

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Malicious practises against his state:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: This shall ye do, so help you righteous God!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: FASTOLFE
line: My gracious sovereign, as I rode from Calais,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: FASTOLFE
line: To haste unto your coronation,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: FASTOLFE
line: A letter was deliver'd to my hands,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: FASTOLFE
line: Writ to your grace from the Duke of Burgundy.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Shame to the Duke of Burgundy and thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: I vow'd, base knight, when I did meet thee next,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: To tear the garter from thy craven's leg,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Which I have done, because unworthily

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Thou wast installed in that high degree.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Pardon me, princely Henry, and the rest

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: This dastard, at the battle of Patay,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: When but in all I was six thousand strong

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And that the French were almost ten to one,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Before we met or that a stroke was given,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Like to a trusty squire did run away:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: In which assault we lost twelve hundred men;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Myself and divers gentlemen beside

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Were there surprised and taken prisoners.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Then judge, great lords, if I have done amiss;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Or whether that such cowards ought to wear

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: This ornament of knighthood, yea or no.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To say the truth, this fact was infamous

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And ill beseeming any common man,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Much more a knight, a captain and a leader.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: When first this order was ordain'd, my lords,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Knights of the garter were of noble birth,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Valiant and virtuous, full of haughty courage,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Such as were grown to credit by the wars;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Not fearing death, nor shrinking for distress,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: But always resolute in most extremes.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: He then that is not furnish'd in this sort

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Doth but usurp the sacred name of knight,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Profaning this most honourable order,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And should, if I were worthy to be judge,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Be quite degraded, like a hedge-born swain

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: That doth presume to boast of gentle blood.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Stain to thy countrymen, thou hear'st thy doom!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Be packing, therefore, thou that wast a knight:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Henceforth we banish thee, on pain of death.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And now, my lord protector, view the letter

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Sent from our uncle Duke of Burgundy.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: What means his grace, that he hath changed his style?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: No more but, plain and bluntly, 'To the king!'

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Hath he forgot he is his sovereign?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Or doth this churlish superscription

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Pretend some alteration in good will?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: What's here?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: 'I have, upon especial cause,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Moved with compassion of my country's wreck,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Together with the pitiful complaints

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Of such as your oppression feeds upon,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Forsaken your pernicious faction

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And join'd with Charles, the rightful King of France.'

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: O monstrous treachery! can this be so,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That in alliance, amity and oaths,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: There should be found such false dissembling guile?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What! doth my uncle Burgundy revolt?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: He doth, my lord, and is become your foe.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Is that the worst this letter doth contain?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: It is the worst, and all, my lord, he writes.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Why, then, Lord Talbot there shall talk with him

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And give him chastisement for this abuse.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How say you, my lord? are you not content?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Content, my liege! yes, but that I am prevented,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: I should have begg'd I might have been employ'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Then gather strength and march unto him straight:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Let him perceive how ill we brook his treason

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And what offence it is to flout his friends.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: I go, my lord, in heart desiring still

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: TALBOT
line: You may behold confusion of your foes.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: Grant me the combat, gracious sovereign.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: And me, my lord, grant me the combat too.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: This is my servant: hear him, noble prince.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: And this is mine: sweet Henry, favour him.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Be patient, lords; and give them leave to speak.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Say, gentlemen, what makes you thus exclaim?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And wherefore crave you combat? or with whom?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: With him, my lord; for he hath done me wrong.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: And I with him; for he hath done me wrong.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What is that wrong whereof you both complain?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: First let me know, and then I'll answer you.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: Crossing the sea from England into France,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: This fellow here, with envious carping tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: Upbraided me about the rose I wear;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: Saying, the sanguine colour of the leaves

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: Did represent my master's blushing cheeks,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: When stubbornly he did repugn the truth

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: About a certain question in the law

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: Argued betwixt the Duke of York and him;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: With other vile and ignominious terms:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: In confutation of which rude reproach

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: And in defence of my lord's worthiness,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: I crave the benefit of law of arms.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: And that is my petition, noble lord:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: For though he seem with forged quaint conceit

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: To set a gloss upon his bold intent,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: Yet know, my lord, I was provoked by him;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: And he first took exceptions at this badge,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: Pronouncing that the paleness of this flower

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: Bewray'd the faintness of my master's heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: Will not this malice, Somerset, be left?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Your private grudge, my Lord of York, will out,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Though ne'er so cunningly you smother it.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Good Lord, what madness rules in brainsick men,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: When for so slight and frivolous a cause

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Such factious emulations shall arise!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Good cousins both, of York and Somerset,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Quiet yourselves, I pray, and be at peace.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: Let this dissension first be tried by fight,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: And then your highness shall command a peace.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: The quarrel toucheth none but us alone;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Betwixt ourselves let us decide it then.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: There is my pledge; accept it, Somerset.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: VERNON
line: Nay, let it rest where it began at first.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: BASSET
line: Confirm it so, mine honourable lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Confirm it so! Confounded be your strife!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And perish ye, with your audacious prate!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Presumptuous vassals, are you not ashamed

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: With this immodest clamorous outrage

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To trouble and disturb the king and us?

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And you, my lords, methinks you do not well

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To bear with their perverse objections;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Much less to take occasion from their mouths

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To raise a mutiny betwixt yourselves:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Let me persuade you take a better course.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: It grieves his highness: good my lords, be friends.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Come hither, you that would be combatants:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Henceforth I charge you, as you love our favour,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Quite to forget this quarrel and the cause.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And you, my lords, remember where we are,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: In France, amongst a fickle wavering nation:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If they perceive dissension in our looks

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And that within ourselves we disagree,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How will their grudging stomachs be provoked

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To wilful disobedience, and rebel!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Beside, what infamy will there arise,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: When foreign princes shall be certified

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That for a toy, a thing of no regard,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: King Henry's peers and chief nobility

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Destroy'd themselves, and lost the realm of France!

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O, think upon the conquest of my father,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My tender years, and let us not forego

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That for a trifle that was bought with blood

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Let me be umpire in this doubtful strife.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I see no reason, if I wear this rose,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That any one should therefore be suspicious

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I more incline to Somerset than York:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Both are my kinsmen, and I love them both:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: As well they may upbraid me with my crown,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Because, forsooth, the king of Scots is crown'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But your discretions better can persuade

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Than I am able to instruct or teach:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And therefore, as we hither came in peace,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So let us still continue peace and love.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Cousin of York, we institute your grace

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To be our regent in these parts of France:

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And, good my Lord of Somerset, unite

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Your troops of horsemen with his bands of foot;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And, like true subjects, sons of your progenitors,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Go cheerfully together and digest.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Your angry choler on your enemies.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ourself, my lord protector and the rest

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: After some respite will return to Calais;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: From thence to England; where I hope ere long

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To be presented, by your victories,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: With Charles, Alencon and that traitorous rout.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: My Lord of York, I promise you, the king

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Prettily, methought, did play the orator.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: And so he did; but yet I like it not,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: In that he wears the badge of Somerset.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Tush, that was but his fancy, blame him not;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I dare presume, sweet prince, he thought no harm.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: An if I wist he did,--but let it rest;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: YORK
line: Other affairs must now be managed.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: Well didst thou, Richard, to suppress thy voice;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: For, had the passions of thy heart burst out,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: I fear we should have seen decipher'd there

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: More rancorous spite, more furious raging broils,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: Than yet can be imagined or supposed.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: But howsoe'er, no simple man that sees

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: This jarring discord of nobility,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: This shouldering of each other in the court,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: This factious bandying of their favourites,

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: But that it doth presage some ill event.

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: 'Tis much when sceptres are in children's hands;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: But more when envy breeds unkind division;

scene: SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.
speaker: EXETER
line: There comes the rain, there begins confusion.

speaker: TALBOT
line: Go to the gates of Bourdeaux, trumpeter:

speaker: TALBOT
line: Summon their general unto the wall.

speaker: TALBOT
line: English John Talbot, captains, calls you forth,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Servant in arms to Harry King of England;

speaker: TALBOT
line: And thus he would: Open your city gates;

speaker: TALBOT
line: Be humble to us; call my sovereign yours,

speaker: TALBOT
line: And do him homage as obedient subjects;

speaker: TALBOT
line: And I'll withdraw me and my bloody power:

speaker: TALBOT
line: But, if you frown upon this proffer'd peace,

speaker: TALBOT
line: You tempt the fury of my three attendants,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Lean famine, quartering steel, and climbing fire;

speaker: TALBOT
line: Who in a moment even with the earth

speaker: TALBOT
line: Shall lay your stately and air-braving towers,

speaker: TALBOT
line: If you forsake the offer of their love.

speaker: General
line: Thou ominous and fearful owl of death,

speaker: General
line: Our nation's terror and their bloody scourge!

speaker: General
line: The period of thy tyranny approacheth.

speaker: General
line: On us thou canst not enter but by death;

speaker: General
line: For, I protest, we are well fortified

speaker: General
line: And strong enough to issue out and fight:

speaker: General
line: If thou retire, the Dauphin, well appointed,

speaker: General
line: Stands with the snares of war to tangle thee:

speaker: General
line: On either hand thee there are squadrons pitch'd,

speaker: General
line: To wall thee from the liberty of flight;

speaker: General
line: And no way canst thou turn thee for redress,

speaker: General
line: But death doth front thee with apparent spoil

speaker: General
line: And pale destruction meets thee in the face.

speaker: General
line: Ten thousand French have ta'en the sacrament

speaker: General
line: To rive their dangerous artillery

speaker: General
line: Upon no Christian soul but English Talbot.

speaker: General
line: Lo, there thou stand'st, a breathing valiant man,

speaker: General
line: Of an invincible unconquer'd spirit!

speaker: General
line: This is the latest glory of thy praise

speaker: General
line: That I, thy enemy, due thee withal;

speaker: General
line: For ere the glass, that now begins to run,

speaker: General
line: Finish the process of his sandy hour,

speaker: General
line: These eyes, that see thee now well coloured,

speaker: General
line: Shall see thee wither'd, bloody, pale and dead.

speaker: General
line: Hark! hark! the Dauphin's drum, a warning bell,

speaker: General
line: Sings heavy music to thy timorous soul;

speaker: General
line: And mine shall ring thy dire departure out.

speaker: TALBOT
line: He fables not; I hear the enemy:

speaker: TALBOT
line: Out, some light horsemen, and peruse their wings.

speaker: TALBOT
line: O, negligent and heedless discipline!

speaker: TALBOT
line: How are we park'd and bounded in a pale,

speaker: TALBOT
line: A little herd of England's timorous deer,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Mazed with a yelping kennel of French curs!

speaker: TALBOT
line: If we be English deer, be then in blood;

speaker: TALBOT
line: Not rascal-like, to fall down with a pinch,

speaker: TALBOT
line: But rather, moody-mad and desperate stags,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Turn on the bloody hounds with heads of steel

speaker: TALBOT
line: And make the cowards stand aloof at bay:

speaker: TALBOT
line: Sell every man his life as dear as mine,

speaker: TALBOT
line: And they shall find dear deer of us, my friends.

speaker: TALBOT
line: God and Saint George, Talbot and England's right,

speaker: TALBOT
line: Prosper our colours in this dangerous fight!

speaker: YORK
line: Are not the speedy scouts return'd again,

speaker: YORK
line: That dogg'd the mighty army of the Dauphin?

speaker: Messenger
line: They are return'd, my lord, and give it out

speaker: Messenger
line: That he is march'd to Bourdeaux with his power,

speaker: Messenger
line: To fight with Talbot: as he march'd along,

speaker: Messenger
line: By your espials were discovered

speaker: Messenger
line: Two mightier troops than that the Dauphin led,

speaker: Messenger
line: Which join'd with him and made their march for Bourdeaux.

speaker: YORK
line: A plague upon that villain Somerset,

speaker: YORK
line: That thus delays my promised supply

speaker: YORK
line: Of horsemen, that were levied for this siege!

speaker: YORK
line: Renowned Talbot doth expect my aid,

speaker: YORK
line: And I am lowted by a traitor villain

speaker: YORK
line: And cannot help the noble chevalier:

speaker: YORK
line: God comfort him in this necessity!

speaker: YORK
line: If he miscarry, farewell wars in France.

speaker: LUCY
line: Thou princely leader of our English strength,

speaker: LUCY
line: Never so needful on the earth of France,

speaker: LUCY
line: Spur to the rescue of the noble Talbot,

speaker: LUCY
line: Who now is girdled with a waist of iron

speaker: LUCY
line: And hemm'd about with grim destruction:

speaker: LUCY
line: To Bourdeaux, warlike duke! to Bourdeaux, York!

speaker: LUCY
line: Else, farewell Talbot, France, and England's honour.

speaker: YORK
line: O God, that Somerset, who in proud heart

speaker: YORK
line: Doth stop my cornets, were in Talbot's place!

speaker: YORK
line: So should we save a valiant gentleman

speaker: YORK
line: By forfeiting a traitor and a coward.

speaker: YORK
line: Mad ire and wrathful fury makes me weep,

speaker: YORK
line: That thus we die, while remiss traitors sleep.

speaker: LUCY
line: O, send some succor to the distress'd lord!

speaker: YORK
line: He dies, we lose; I break my warlike word;

speaker: YORK
line: We mourn, France smiles; we lose, they daily get;

speaker: YORK
line: All 'long of this vile traitor Somerset.

speaker: LUCY
line: Then God take mercy on brave Talbot's soul;

speaker: LUCY
line: And on his son young John, who two hours since

speaker: LUCY
line: I met in travel toward his warlike father!

speaker: LUCY
line: This seven years did not Talbot see his son;

speaker: LUCY
line: And now they meet where both their lives are done.

speaker: YORK
line: Alas, what joy shall noble Talbot have

speaker: YORK
line: To bid his young son welcome to his grave?

speaker: YORK
line: Away! vexation almost stops my breath,

speaker: YORK
line: That sunder'd friends greet in the hour of death.

speaker: YORK
line: Lucy, farewell; no more my fortune can,

speaker: YORK
line: But curse the cause I cannot aid the man.

speaker: YORK
line: Maine, Blois, Poictiers, and Tours, are won away,

speaker: YORK
line: 'Long all of Somerset and his delay.

speaker: LUCY
line: Thus, while the vulture of sedition

speaker: LUCY
line: Feeds in the bosom of such great commanders,

speaker: LUCY
line: Sleeping neglection doth betray to loss

speaker: LUCY
line: The conquest of our scarce cold conqueror,

speaker: LUCY
line: That ever living man of memory,

speaker: LUCY
line: Henry the Fifth: whiles they each other cross,

speaker: LUCY
line: Lives, honours, lands and all hurry to loss.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: It is too late; I cannot send them now:

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: This expedition was by York and Talbot

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Too rashly plotted: all our general force

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Might with a sally of the very town

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Be buckled with: the over-daring Talbot

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Hath sullied all his gloss of former honour

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: By this unheedful, desperate, wild adventure:

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: York set him on to fight and die in shame,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: That, Talbot dead, great York might bear the name.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: Captain
line: Here is Sir William Lucy, who with me

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: Captain
line: Set from our o'ermatch'd forces forth for aid.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: How now, Sir William! whither were you sent?

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Whither, my lord? from bought and sold Lord Talbot;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Who, ring'd about with bold adversity,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Cries out for noble York and Somerset,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: To beat assailing death from his weak legions:

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: And whiles the honourable captain there

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Drops bloody sweat from his war-wearied limbs,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: And, in advantage lingering, looks for rescue,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: You, his false hopes, the trust of England's honour,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Keep off aloof with worthless emulation.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Let not your private discord keep away

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: The levied succors that should lend him aid,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: While he, renowned noble gentleman,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Yields up his life unto a world of odds:

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Orleans the Bastard, Charles, Burgundy,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Alencon, Reignier, compass him about,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: And Talbot perisheth by your default.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: York set him on; York should have sent him aid.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: And York as fast upon your grace exclaims;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Swearing that you withhold his levied host,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Collected for this expedition.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: York lies; he might have sent and had the horse;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: I owe him little duty, and less love;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: And take foul scorn to fawn on him by sending.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: The fraud of England, not the force of France,

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Hath now entrapp'd the noble-minded Talbot:

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Never to England shall he bear his life;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: But dies, betray'd to fortune by your strife.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Come, go; I will dispatch the horsemen straight:

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Within six hours they will be at his aid.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: Too late comes rescue: he is ta'en or slain;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: For fly he could not, if he would have fled;

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: And fly would Talbot never, though he might.

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: If he be dead, brave Talbot, then adieu!

scene: SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.
speaker: LUCY
line: His fame lives in the world, his shame in you.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: O young John Talbot! I did send for thee

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: To tutor thee in stratagems of war,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: That Talbot's name might be in thee revived

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: When sapless age and weak unable limbs

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Should bring thy father to his drooping chair.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: But, O malignant and ill-boding stars!

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Now thou art come unto a feast of death,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: A terrible and unavoided danger:

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Therefore, dear boy, mount on my swiftest horse;

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And I'll direct thee how thou shalt escape

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: By sudden flight: come, dally not, be gone.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Is my name Talbot? and am I your son?

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: And shall I fly? O if you love my mother,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Dishonour not her honourable name,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: To make a bastard and a slave of me!

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: The world will say, he is not Talbot's blood,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: That basely fled when noble Talbot stood.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Fly, to revenge my death, if I be slain.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: He that flies so will ne'er return again.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: If we both stay, we both are sure to die.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Then let me stay; and, father, do you fly:

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Your loss is great, so your regard should be;

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: My worth unknown, no loss is known in me.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Upon my death the French can little boast;

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: In yours they will, in you all hopes are lost.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Flight cannot stain the honour you have won;

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: But mine it will, that no exploit have done:

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: You fled for vantage, everyone will swear;

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: But, if I bow, they'll say it was for fear.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: There is no hope that ever I will stay,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: If the first hour I shrink and run away.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Here on my knee I beg mortality,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Rather than life preserved with infamy.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Shall all thy mother's hopes lie in one tomb?

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Ay, rather than I'll shame my mother's womb.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Upon my blessing, I command thee go.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: To fight I will, but not to fly the foe.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Part of thy father may be saved in thee.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: No part of him but will be shame in me.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Thou never hadst renown, nor canst not lose it.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Yes, your renowned name: shall flight abuse it?

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Thy father's charge shall clear thee from that stain.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: You cannot witness for me, being slain.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: If death be so apparent, then both fly.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And leave my followers here to fight and die?

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: My age was never tainted with such shame.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: And shall my youth be guilty of such blame?

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: No more can I be sever'd from your side,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Than can yourself yourself in twain divide:

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Stay, go, do what you will, the like do I;

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: For live I will not, if my father die.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Then here I take my leave of thee, fair son,

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Born to eclipse thy life this afternoon.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Come, side by side together live and die.

scene: SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And soul with soul from France to heaven fly.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Saint George and victory! fight, soldiers, fight.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: The regent hath with Talbot broke his word

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And left us to the rage of France his sword.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Where is John Talbot? Pause, and take thy breath;

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: I gave thee life and rescued thee from death.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: O, twice my father, twice am I thy son!

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: The life thou gavest me first was lost and done,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Till with thy warlike sword, despite of late,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: To my determined time thou gavest new date.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: When from the Dauphin's crest thy sword struck fire,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: It warm'd thy father's heart with proud desire

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Of bold-faced victory. Then leaden age,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Quicken'd with youthful spleen and warlike rage,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Beat down Alencon, Orleans, Burgundy,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And from the pride of Gallia rescued thee.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: The ireful bastard Orleans, that drew blood

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: From thee, my boy, and had the maidenhood

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Of thy first fight, I soon encountered,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And interchanging blows I quickly shed

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Some of his bastard blood; and in disgrace

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Bespoke him thus; 'Contaminated, base

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And misbegotten blood I spill of thine,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Mean and right poor, for that pure blood of mine

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Which thou didst force from Talbot, my brave boy:'

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Here, purposing the Bastard to destroy,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Came in strong rescue. Speak, thy father's care,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Art thou not weary, John? how dost thou fare?

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Wilt thou yet leave the battle, boy, and fly,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Now thou art seal'd the son of chivalry?

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Fly, to revenge my death when I am dead:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: The help of one stands me in little stead.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: O, too much folly is it, well I wot,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: To hazard all our lives in one small boat!

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: If I to-day die not with Frenchmen's rage,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: To-morrow I shall die with mickle age:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: By me they nothing gain an if I stay;

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: 'Tis but the shortening of my life one day:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: In thee thy mother dies, our household's name,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: My death's revenge, thy youth, and England's fame:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: All these and more we hazard by thy stay;

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: All these are saved if thou wilt fly away.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: The sword of Orleans hath not made me smart;

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: These words of yours draw life-blood from my heart:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: On that advantage, bought with such a shame,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: To save a paltry life and slay bright fame,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Before young Talbot from old Talbot fly,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: The coward horse that bears me fail and die!

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: And like me to the peasant boys of France,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: To be shame's scorn and subject of mischance!

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Surely, by all the glory you have won,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: An if I fly, I am not Talbot's son:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: Then talk no more of flight, it is no boot;

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: JOHN TALBOT
line: If son to Talbot, die at Talbot's foot.

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Then follow thou thy desperate sire of Crete,

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Thou Icarus; thy life to me is sweet:

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: If thou wilt fight, fight by thy father's side;

scene: SCENE VI.  A field of battle.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And, commendable proved, let's die in pride.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Where is my other life? mine own is gone;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: O, where's young Talbot? where is valiant John?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Triumphant death, smear'd with captivity,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Young Talbot's valour makes me smile at thee:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: When he perceived me shrink and on my knee,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: His bloody sword he brandish'd over me,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And, like a hungry lion, did commence

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Rough deeds of rage and stern impatience;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: But when my angry guardant stood alone,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Tendering my ruin and assail'd of none,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Dizzy-eyed fury and great rage of heart

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Suddenly made him from my side to start

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Into the clustering battle of the French;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: And in that sea of blood my boy did drench

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: His over-mounting spirit, and there died,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: My Icarus, my blossom, in his pride.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Servant
line: O, my dear lord, lo, where your son is borne!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Thou antic death, which laugh'st us here to scorn,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Anon, from thy insulting tyranny,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Coupled in bonds of perpetuity,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Two Talbots, winged through the lither sky,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: In thy despite shall 'scape mortality.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: O, thou, whose wounds become hard-favour'd death,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Speak to thy father ere thou yield thy breath!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Brave death by speaking, whether he will or no;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Imagine him a Frenchman and thy foe.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Poor boy! he smiles, methinks, as who should say,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Had death been French, then death had died to-day.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Come, come and lay him in his father's arms:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: My spirit can no longer bear these harms.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Soldiers, adieu! I have what I would have,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: TALBOT
line: Now my old arms are young John Talbot's grave.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Had York and Somerset brought rescue in,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: We should have found a bloody day of this.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
line: How the young whelp of Talbot's, raging-wood,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
line: Did flesh his puny sword in Frenchmen's blood!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Once I encounter'd him, and thus I said:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: 'Thou maiden youth, be vanquish'd by a maid:'

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: But, with a proud majestical high scorn,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: He answer'd thus: 'Young Talbot was not born

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: To be the pillage of a giglot wench:'

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: So, rushing in the bowels of the French,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: He left me proudly, as unworthy fight.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Doubtless he would have made a noble knight;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: See, where he lies inhearsed in the arms

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BURGUNDY
line: Of the most bloody nurser of his harms!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
line: Hew them to pieces, hack their bones asunder

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
line: Whose life was England's glory, Gallia's wonder.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: O, no, forbear! for that which we have fled

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: During the life, let us not wrong it dead.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Herald, conduct me to the Dauphin's tent,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: To know who hath obtained the glory of the day.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: On what submissive message art thou sent?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Submission, Dauphin! 'tis a mere French word;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: We English warriors wot not what it means.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: I come to know what prisoners thou hast ta'en

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: And to survey the bodies of the dead.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: For prisoners ask'st thou? hell our prison is.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: But tell me whom thou seek'st.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: But where's the great Alcides of the field,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Valiant Lord Talbot, Earl of Shrewsbury,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Created, for his rare success in arms,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Great Earl of Washford, Waterford and Valence;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Lord Talbot of Goodrig and Urchinfield,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Lord Strange of Blackmere, Lord Verdun of Alton,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Lord Cromwell of Wingfield, Lord Furnival of Sheffield,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: The thrice-victorious Lord of Falconbridge;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Knight of the noble order of Saint George,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Worthy Saint Michael and the Golden Fleece;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Great marshal to Henry the Sixth

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Of all his wars within the realm of France?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Here is a silly stately style indeed!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: The Turk, that two and fifty kingdoms hath,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Writes not so tedious a style as this.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Him that thou magnifiest with all these titles

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Stinking and fly-blown lies here at our feet.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Is Talbot slain, the Frenchmen's only scourge,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Your kingdom's terror and black Nemesis?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: O, were mine eyeballs into bullets turn'd,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: That I in rage might shoot them at your faces!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: O, that I could but call these dead to life!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: It were enough to fright the realm of France:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Were but his picture left amongst you here,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: It would amaze the proudest of you all.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: Give me their bodies, that I may bear them hence

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: And give them burial as beseems their worth.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: I think this upstart is old Talbot's ghost,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: He speaks with such a proud commanding spirit.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: For God's sake let him have 'em; to keep them here,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: They would but stink, and putrefy the air.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Go, take their bodies hence.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: I'll bear them hence; but from their ashes shall be rear'd

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LUCY
line: A phoenix that shall make all France afeard.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: So we be rid of them, do with 'em what thou wilt.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: And now to Paris, in this conquering vein:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CHARLES
line: All will be ours, now bloody Talbot's slain.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Have you perused the letters from the pope,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The emperor and the Earl of Armagnac?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I have, my lord: and their intent is this:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: They humbly sue unto your excellence

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To have a godly peace concluded of

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Between the realms of England and of France.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How doth your grace affect their motion?
