line: O, burn her, burn her! hanging is too good.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Take her away; for she hath lived too long,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: To fill the world with vicious qualities.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: First, let me tell you whom you have condemn'd:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Not me begotten of a shepherd swain,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: But issued from the progeny of kings;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Virtuous and holy; chosen from above,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: By inspiration of celestial grace,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: To work exceeding miracles on earth.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: I never had to do with wicked spirits:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: But you, that are polluted with your lusts,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Stain'd with the guiltless blood of innocents,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Corrupt and tainted with a thousand vices,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Because you want the grace that others have,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: You judge it straight a thing impossible

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: To compass wonders but by help of devils.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: No, misconceived! Joan of Arc hath been

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: A virgin from her tender infancy,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Chaste and immaculate in very thought;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Whose maiden blood, thus rigorously effused,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Will cry for vengeance at the gates of heaven.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Ay, ay: away with her to execution!

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And hark ye, sirs; because she is a maid,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Spare for no faggots, let there be enow:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Place barrels of pitch upon the fatal stake,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That so her torture may be shortened.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Will nothing turn your unrelenting hearts?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Then, Joan, discover thine infirmity,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: That warranteth by law to be thy privilege.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: I am with child, ye bloody homicides:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Murder not then the fruit within my womb,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Although ye hale me to a violent death.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Now heaven forfend! the holy maid with child!

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: The greatest miracle that e'er ye wrought:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Is all your strict preciseness come to this?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: She and the Dauphin have been juggling:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: I did imagine what would be her refuge.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Well, go to; we'll have no bastards live;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Especially since Charles must father it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: You are deceived; my child is none of his:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: It was Alencon that enjoy'd my love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Alencon! that notorious Machiavel!

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: It dies, an if it had a thousand lives.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: O, give me leave, I have deluded you:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: 'Twas neither Charles nor yet the duke I named,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: But Reignier, king of Naples, that prevail'd.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: A married man! that's most intolerable.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Why, here's a girl! I think she knows not well,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: There were so many, whom she may accuse.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: It's sign she hath been liberal and free.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: And yet, forsooth, she is a virgin pure.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Strumpet, thy words condemn thy brat and thee:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Use no entreaty, for it is in vain.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Then lead me hence; with whom I leave my curse:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: May never glorious sun reflex his beams

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Upon the country where you make abode;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: But darkness and the gloomy shade of death

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Environ you, till mischief and despair

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
line: Drive you to break your necks or hang yourselves!

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Break thou in pieces and consume to ashes,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Thou foul accursed minister of hell!

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Lord regent, I do greet your excellence

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: With letters of commission from the king.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: For know, my lords, the states of Christendom,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Moved with remorse of these outrageous broils,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Have earnestly implored a general peace

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Betwixt our nation and the aspiring French;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: And here at hand the Dauphin and his train

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Approacheth, to confer about some matter.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Is all our travail turn'd to this effect?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: After the slaughter of so many peers,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: So many captains, gentlemen and soldiers,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: That in this quarrel have been overthrown

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: And sold their bodies for their country's benefit,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Shall we at last conclude effeminate peace?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Have we not lost most part of all the towns,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: By treason, falsehood and by treachery,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Our great progenitors had conquered?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: O Warwick, Warwick! I foresee with grief

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: The utter loss of all the realm of France.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Be patient, York: if we conclude a peace,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: It shall be with such strict and severe covenants

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: As little shall the Frenchmen gain thereby.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Since, lords of England, it is thus agreed

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: That peaceful truce shall be proclaim'd in France,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: We come to be informed by yourselves

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: What the conditions of that league must be.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Speak, Winchester; for boiling choler chokes

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: The hollow passage of my poison'd voice,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: By sight of these our baleful enemies.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Charles, and the rest, it is enacted thus:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: That, in regard King Henry gives consent,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Of mere compassion and of lenity,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: To ease your country of distressful war,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: And suffer you to breathe in fruitful peace,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: You shall become true liegemen to his crown:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: And Charles, upon condition thou wilt swear

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: To pay him tribute, submit thyself,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: Thou shalt be placed as viceroy under him,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER
line: And still enjoy thy regal dignity.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: Must he be then as shadow of himself?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: Adorn his temples with a coronet,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: And yet, in substance and authority,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: Retain but privilege of a private man?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: This proffer is absurd and reasonless.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: 'Tis known already that I am possess'd

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: With more than half the Gallian territories,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: And therein reverenced for their lawful king:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Shall I, for lucre of the rest unvanquish'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Detract so much from that prerogative,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: As to be call'd but viceroy of the whole?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: No, lord ambassador, I'll rather keep

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: That which I have than, coveting for more,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Be cast from possibility of all.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Insulting Charles! hast thou by secret means

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Used intercession to obtain a league,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: And, now the matter grows to compromise,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Stand'st thou aloof upon comparison?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Either accept the title thou usurp'st,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Of benefit proceeding from our king

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: And not of any challenge of desert,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Or we will plague thee with incessant wars.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: REIGNIER
line: My lord, you do not well in obstinacy

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: REIGNIER
line: To cavil in the course of this contract:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: REIGNIER
line: If once it be neglected, ten to one

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: REIGNIER
line: We shall not find like opportunity.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: To say the truth, it is your policy

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: To save your subjects from such massacre

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: And ruthless slaughters as are daily seen

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: By our proceeding in hostility;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: And therefore take this compact of a truce,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: ALENCON
line: Although you break it when your pleasure serves.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: WARWICK
line: How say'st thou, Charles? shall our condition stand?

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: It shall;

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: Only reserved, you claim no interest

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: CHARLES
line: In any of our towns of garrison.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Then swear allegiance to his majesty,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: As thou art knight, never to disobey

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Nor be rebellious to the crown of England,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Thou, nor thy nobles, to the crown of England.

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: So, now dismiss your army when ye please:

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: Hang up your ensign, let your drums be still,

scene: SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.
speaker: YORK
line: For here we entertain a solemn peace.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Your wondrous rare description, noble earl,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Of beauteous Margaret hath astonish'd me:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Her virtues graced with external gifts

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Do breed love's settled passions in my heart:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And like as rigor of tempestuous gusts

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Provokes the mightiest hulk against the tide,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So am I driven by breath of her renown

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Either to suffer shipwreck or arrive

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Where I may have fruition of her love.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Tush, my good lord, this superficial tale

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Is but a preface of her worthy praise;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The chief perfections of that lovely dame

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Had I sufficient skill to utter them,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Would make a volume of enticing lines,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Able to ravish any dull conceit:

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And, which is more, she is not so divine,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: So full-replete with choice of all delights,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But with as humble lowliness of mind

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: She is content to be at your command;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Command, I mean, of virtuous chaste intents,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To love and honour Henry as her lord.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And otherwise will Henry ne'er presume.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Therefore, my lord protector, give consent

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That Margaret may be England's royal queen.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: So should I give consent to flatter sin.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: You know, my lord, your highness is betroth'd

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Unto another lady of esteem:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: How shall we then dispense with that contract,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And not deface your honour with reproach?

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As doth a ruler with unlawful oaths;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Or one that, at a triumph having vow'd

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To try his strength, forsaketh yet the lists

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: By reason of his adversary's odds:

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A poor earl's daughter is unequal odds,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And therefore may be broke without offence.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, what, I pray, is Margaret more than that?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Her father is no better than an earl,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Although in glorious titles he excel.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Yes, lord, her father is a king,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The King of Naples and Jerusalem;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And of such great authority in France

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As his alliance will confirm our peace

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And keep the Frenchmen in allegiance.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And so the Earl of Armagnac may do,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Because he is near kinsman unto Charles.

speaker: EXETER
line: Beside, his wealth doth warrant a liberal dower,

speaker: EXETER
line: Where Reignier sooner will receive than give.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A dower, my lords! disgrace not so your king,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: That he should be so abject, base and poor,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To choose for wealth and not for perfect love.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Henry is able to enrich his queen

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And not seek a queen to make him rich:

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: So worthless peasants bargain for their wives,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As market-men for oxen, sheep, or horse.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Marriage is a matter of more worth

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Than to be dealt in by attorneyship;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Not whom we will, but whom his grace affects,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Must be companion of his nuptial bed:

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And therefore, lords, since he affects her most,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: It most of all these reasons bindeth us,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: In our opinions she should be preferr'd.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: For what is wedlock forced but a hell,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: An age of discord and continual strife?

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Whereas the contrary bringeth bliss,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And is a pattern of celestial peace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Whom should we match with Henry, being a king,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But Margaret, that is daughter to a king?

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Her peerless feature, joined with her birth,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Approves her fit for none but for a king:

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Her valiant courage and undaunted spirit,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: More than in women commonly is seen,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Will answer our hope in issue of a king;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: For Henry, son unto a conqueror,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Is likely to beget more conquerors,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: If with a lady of so high resolve

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As is fair Margaret he be link'd in love.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Then yield, my lords; and here conclude with me

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: That Margaret shall be queen, and none but she.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whether it be through force of your report,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My noble Lord of Suffolk, or for that

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My tender youth was never yet attaint

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: With any passion of inflaming love,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I cannot tell; but this I am assured,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I feel such sharp dissension in my breast,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Such fierce alarums both of hope and fear,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: As I am sick with working of my thoughts.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Take, therefore, shipping; post, my lord, to France;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Agree to any covenants, and procure

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That Lady Margaret do vouchsafe to come

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To cross the seas to England and be crown'd

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: King Henry's faithful and anointed queen:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For your expenses and sufficient charge,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Among the people gather up a tenth.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Be gone, I say; for, till you do return,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I rest perplexed with a thousand cares.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And you, good uncle, banish all offence:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If you do censure me by what you were,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Not what you are, I know it will excuse

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: This sudden execution of my will.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And so, conduct me where, from company,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I may revolve and ruminate my grief.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ay, grief, I fear me, both at first and last.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Thus Suffolk hath prevail'd; and thus he goes,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As did the youthful Paris once to Greece,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: With hope to find the like event in love,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But prosper better than the Trojan did.

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Margaret shall now be queen, and rule the king;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But I will rule both her, the king and realm.
